Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in MAC 2313, and permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Methods of solution for first order equations. Linear equations. Numerical methods; Laplace transforms. Series solutions. Selected applications. Students will complete projects. For Honors students from all disciplines.

MAP3482H - Honors Systems Modeling and S.name: MAP3482H - Honors Systems Modeling and Simulation

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Population growth dynamics; spread of an epidemic; ecological predator-prey relationships; insulin and its use in the control of diabetes; economic systems.

MAP3923 - Frontiers in Mathematical Rese.name: MAP3923 - Frontiers in Mathematical Research: Colloquia and Public Talks

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Current research in mathematics and related fields, as presented by leading national and international researchers. May not be used to satisfy requirements for mathematics major or minor.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, and MAP 2302, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to the study of mathematical modeling.

MAP4371 - Numerical Methods for Differen.name: MAP4371 - Numerical Methods for Differential Equations

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2313, and MAP 2302, and COP 3223C, and MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Numerical theory and practices used in solving ordinary differential equations and PDE. Covers Euler's method, trapezoidal rule, multi-step methods, Runge-Kutta, error control, finite differences, implicit and explicit schemes, iterative methods, and stability.

MAP4113 - Probability, Random Processes.name: MAP4113 - Probability, Random Processes and Applications

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Elementary probability theory; modes of convergence; martingales, Gaussian, Wiener, and diffusion processes; Brownian motion; applications.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced topics in applied mathematics. Selection of topics will vary.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in MAC 2313, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Methods of solution for first order equations. Linear equations. Laplace transforms. Series solutions. Selected applications.

MAP4112 - Mathematical Foundations of Ma.name: MAP4112 - Mathematical Foundations of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Expectation Maximalization algorithm, Projections Principal Component Analysis, Mixture Models, Support Vector Machines, Kernel methods.

MAP4384 - Numerical Methods for Computat.name: MAP4384 - Numerical Methods for Computational Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAP 2302, and COP 3223C, and MAS 3105 or MAS 3106.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theory of modern methods of numerical computation and numerical analysis in linear algebra and differential equations; non-linear optimization, finite element methods, adaptive quadrature.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Binomial no-arbitrage pricing model, Martingales, Markov processes, capital asset pricing model, stopping times, American derivative securities, random walks, interest rates, fixed-income derivatives, futures.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, and MAP 2302, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Vector calculus. The theorems of Green, Gauss and Stokes. Introduction to tensors. Application in engineering and physical sciences.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Population models & models for the spread of infectious diseases, evolutionary game theory, excitable systems for neuron dynamics, reaction kinetics models, foraging theory,

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Modeling methodologies: choosing, applying, and interpreting mathematical models and analysis for data problems.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAP 2302, and MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Systems of linear differential equations, numerical solutions introduction, stability theory & phase plane analysis, introduction to limit cycles, bifurcations & chaos, power series solutions of differential equations.

MAP4341 - Introduction to Partial Differ.name: MAP4341 - Introduction to Partial Differential Equations

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAP 2302, and MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to second-order linear partial differential equations - heat, wave and Laplace equations, separation of variables in PDEs, Sturm-Liouville eigenvalue problems, Fourier series analysis and Green's functions, Laplace and Fourier transform methods.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Green's Functions, Integral Transforms, Laplace and Fourier transforms applied to heat, wave and potential equations. Bessel functions, Legendre functions, Fourier-Bessel series, PDEs in higher dimensions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAP 2302, and MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Differential equation models for population growth, harvesting, populations with Allee effects, infectious disease spread, predator-prey systems, competitive systems, mutualism, spatial spread of populations and genes.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2313, and MAP 2302, and MAS 3105 or MAS 3106, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Linear programming, dynamic programming, control theory, integer programming.
